abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental and social assessment
            for the Third Power System Development Project for India
            outlines possible negative impacts and proposes measures to
            mitigate them. Expected negative environmental impacts can
            be mitigated as follows: Avoid affecting natural and
            socio-cultural resources by carefully selecting routes using
            techniques/tools like GIS and GPS aerial photography. Obtain
            prior approval and have forestry department supervise when
            passing transmission lines through forest and protected
            areas. Provide construction crews with fuel wood or
            alternative fuels to minimize fuel collecting. Pay
            compensation for crop damage or other damage to farmland,
            and restore on-farm works after construction ends. Reroute
            telecom circuits, convert overhead telecom circuits into
            cables, etc. to minimize voltage interference. Maintain
            adequate clearance between transmission lines and railways,
            civil aviation, and defense installations. Paint airport
            towers beyond specified height for easy visibility and place
            warning lights on top of these towers. Where drainage is
            affected, train flow and guide it to safe zones. Adopt
            safety measures to avoid fires due to flashover from lines.
            Resurface the areas where excavation works are done. Restore
            surfaces with topsoil. Select dumping areas to for rocky
            material and use as fill for tower foundations. Plant trees
            along roads to buffer visual effect. Paint towers to blend
            into background. Provide sound and vibration dampers, and
            maintain equipment to reduce noise. Reduce nuisance to
            nearby properties by using tractors and manual labor.
            Execute work during light traffic periods. Avoid rainy
            season, cut and fill slopes, use retaining walls, and sow
            soil-binding grasses to control erosion. Protect worker
            health and safety. There are no significant issues regarding
            management of levels of polychlorinated biphenyls PCBs)
            formerly used as insulating material in capacitors and transformers.
